OpenSim.Region.ScriptEngine.Shared.YieldProlog.IndexedAnswers Class Reference

An IndexedAnswers holds answers to a query based on the values of index arguments. More...

Public Member Functions

void addAnswer (object[] answer)
 Append the answer to the list and update the indexes, if any. Elements of answer must be ground, since arguments with unbound variables make this into a dynamic rule which we don't index.
IEnumerable< bool > clause (object Head, object Body)
 IndexedAnswers (int arity)
IEnumerable< bool > match (object[] arguments)
void prependAnswer (object[] answer)
 Prepend the answer to the list and clear the indexes so that they must be re-computed on the next call to match. (Only addAnswer will maintain the indexes while adding answers.) Elements of answer must be ground, since arguments with unbound variables make this into a dynamic rule which we don't index.
IEnumerable< bool > retract (object Head, object Body)

Static Public Member Functions

static object getIndexValue (object value)
 If we keep an index on value, return the value, or null if we don't index it.

Detailed Description

An IndexedAnswers holds answers to a query based on the values of index arguments.

Member Function Documentation

void OpenSim.Region.ScriptEngine.Shared.YieldProlog.IndexedAnswers.addAnswer ( object[]  answer  ) 

Append the answer to the list and update the indexes, if any. Elements of answer must be ground, since arguments with unbound variables make this into a dynamic rule which we don't index.

Parameters:
answer 
static object OpenSim.Region.ScriptEngine.Shared.YieldProlog.IndexedAnswers.getIndexValue ( object  value  )  [static]

If we keep an index on value, return the value, or null if we don't index it.

Parameters:
value the term to examine. Assume you already called YP.getValue(value)
Returns:
void OpenSim.Region.ScriptEngine.Shared.YieldProlog.IndexedAnswers.prependAnswer ( object[]  answer  ) 

Prepend the answer to the list and clear the indexes so that they must be re-computed on the next call to match. (Only addAnswer will maintain the indexes while adding answers.) Elements of answer must be ground, since arguments with unbound variables make this into a dynamic rule which we don't index.

Parameters:
answer
